newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real falls 0.1 pct on dollar outflows.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real falls 0.1 pct on dollar outflows.

text.p: Brazil's real dropped 0.1 percent on dollar outflows to close at 1.0171 against the dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Tuesday deficit of $50 million.
The real was down slightly in the morning in mild trade, but began to drop steeply after lunch when daily dollar flows started to show a deficit, dealers said.
In the interbank foreign exchange floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0210 to the dollar, up 0.01 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real rose 0.1 percent to end at 1.027 per greenback, traders said.
